extendedInfo.description: UNIVERSAL COPY AND PASTE!**If you are upgrading from a previous version, please UNINSTALL the app and then REINSTALL. A simple update will not work.**Copy text from ANY screen to your clipboard. Then, paste it into any text box by long pressing on it.Use this to have copy paste functionality from ANY app!- Copy text using on-board or networked OCR recognition.- Copy by shaking phone.- Copy by long-pressing on search button.- Copy to clipboard by pressing overlay button.- Support for many different languages.Tags: Copy Paste Clipboard

reviews.title: No \"Exit\", but does what it says...
reviews.comment: Works on my LG P500, which is rooted, but didn\'t ask for Superuser rights. Author didn\'t reply to email asking to add Exit function. Had to kill program from system settings. Not worth 7$ for what it does.

reviews.title: Bait and switch
reviews.comment: Asking for root privileges, my phone is rooted and privileges were given via superuser. App claims that root privileges have not been granted and redirects to another (paid) app.

reviews.title: Galaxy Tab--Yes, Does Work!
reviews.comment: Some flaws, since it is using OCR vs a true \"copy & paste.\"  But its Ok overall. Just pull down your menu tab at top of screen & activate the capture by tapping the clipboard--its relatively good.

reviews.title: English Only
reviews.comment: This app is one of a kind, well designed and great overall, but it cannot properly copy characters of foreign languages (I tried copying some Japanese Kanji and Hiragana and later a few sentences of Arabic) I rate it 4/5 because of this; otherwise the app is fantastic.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Works for Samsung Captivate SGH-I897 W/O Root
reviews.comment: What do you do when an OS has native support for image processing and character recognition but is too stupid to support pervasive character copy? Take a picture and OCR that sucker of course! A working solution and a beautiful example of \'winning ugly.\'  It works thus far w/o a need to root the phone, but I\'ve only put it through a few applications. I will change my font to a more easily OCR\'d screen font. Corrections to processed text are necessary of course; as it\'s an OCR program running on a limited processor. I haven\'t used \'network processing\' to increase accuracy yet; I\'m not sure I can take the performance hit. Before you complain about accuracy, please try adjusting your font. I\'ll miss my custom font, but I\'m willing to do what it takes to work-around another of Android\'s design flaws. Why Android wasn\'t written with the assumption that users should be able to copy character based text from any screen is beyond my ken. Serious kudos to Edward Kim for using the platform\'s strengths to combat one of its weaknesses.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: WHAT?
reviews.comment: When I open the Trial.. it says \"will not work on my non rooted device\".. and says to download the pay version because it WILL work\" with my UN rooted device.... and gives me the dl link. Okaaaaay.. I have no problem paying BUT when I click the link via the trial that promises to work, it says it MAY NOT work with my device? .......... which is it? Why send me to an app you say will work, but then when I land at the app.. it says \"maybe\"?  Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 tablet, ics 4.0.4. Will pay version work or not? Will change rating to 5 stars if I get an answer. Thanks.
reviews.author: A Google User
